channel.title: Ruby on I Prefer Jim
channel.description: Recent content in Ruby on I Prefer Jim

item.title: Computer Science Programming Basics In Ruby
item.description: Computer Science Programming Basics In Ruby Originally submitted at O’Reilly Product: Computer Science Programming Basics in Ruby by oreilly Submitted at: O’Reilly Great intro to basics!

item.title: Rails 3 + RSpec + Rake tasks are missing
item.description: Recently, I installed Rails 3 using rvm. I wanted to follow quickly through Rails 3 in Action so I could see the differences between Rails 2.

item.title: CopyCat Rails’ Time Extensions
item.description: I’ve become a fan of Ruby’s simple syntax. My favorite thing is the ActiveSupport’s Numeric Time Extensions. I’m starting a library of useful extensions, and I’m going to be adding a number of shortcuts to mock these extensions.

item.title: Ruby and Python in your script tags!
item.description: I came across this weeks ago, and I’m surprised I never posted it. This is a javascript ‘framework’ to add ruby and python languages in your script tags.

item.title: Example Ruby code
item.description: I decided to do some of those Facebook puzzles in Ruby. I won’t post everything I do, because I would consider that cheating (after all, you can win prizes!

item.title: Ruby on Rails, Aptana Studio
item.description: This weekend, I decided to give Ruby on Rails a go, considering I just finished school and I’ll have plenty of free time to explore.
